attributes.action: Include no option to remain in the EU in any second EU referendum/People's Vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Of those who voted in the EU referendum, the majority eliminated the option to remain by voting to leave. 

In the 2017 General Election the majority of voters eliminated the option to remain again by voting for parties with manifestos to honour the result of the EU referendum.

In the event that there is a second EU referendum (People's Vote) the options must therefore be restricted to differing proposals of leaving the EU.
attributes.background: In 2016 the people rejected the option to remain in the EU by voting to leave the EU.  Having rejected remaining in the EU any "Peoples' Vote" or second EU referendum must honour the people's decision to reject that option and must include no option to remain in the EU.
